Woke up this morning in California to the terrible news of the horrible terrorist attack that killed hundreds of innocent people in Sinai, Egypt.
My thoughts and prayers are with the victims of this terrible atrocity, and with their families and friends.

Providing media production workshops and educational websites to further the the knowledge base of individuals in the field of media production. We are currently focusing in two areas, the development of media production business skills and lighting skills. Our target demographic is the growing media freelance workforce.
Serving all of Los Angeles with the highest production value possible.
Serving greater San Diego county with all of your production equipment and crewing needs! Experienced and skilled crews that will bring your production in on time and on budget! 714-609-3545

I own and run Burnies Grip and Lighting Inc. (714-609-3545) the biggest grip and lighting house south of Los Angeles. We supply feature films, network television shows, cable channels, corporate and industrial media with all their production needs. We serve all of Southern California, from Santa Barbara to San Diego, and as far east as Palm Springs and Las Vegas. We pride ourselves on our customer service and working within our clients production budgets.
I've made a twenty year study of Media Production Management. Excelling in Lighting, Production Value, Media Distribution, Crew and Time Management.

recommendations: John Fishback
Owner, P&P Studios Inc.
August 21, 2014, John was a client of Craig "Burnie"’s

Since 2009 I have worked with Burnie every time I've shot in the San Diego area (whcih has been at least once a year). He's as good as it gets. He has the gear, knowledge, experience and desire to do the best job every time on a job of any size. I met Burnie for the first time when we were shooting interviews in Laguna Beach. I hired one of his interview lighting and grip packages. I was blown away when Burnie personally delivered the gear. A year later I hired Burnie for 7 shoots in San Diego. He's been our go-to guy ever since. You will not be disappointed when you hire Burnie!

Mike Kirsch
Director, Writer and Editor at Cinematek Creative
August 5, 2013, Mike was a client of Craig "Burnie"’s

I've worked with Burnie since 2003, and ever since I had my own production shop in 2006 he has been my first and only call for Grip and Electric rentals, but he also provides so much more than that. I call Burnie whenever I'm planning a shoot. Long before I'm ready to book a shoot date, I consult Burnie about the cameras I'm planning to use, the locations I'll be shooting at and the type of video I need to make. I bring him in early because the expertise he brings as a consultant is worth everything to my productions. He's smart, fast and always has the best interest of my final product in mind. Burnie's knowledge as a Gaffer is extensive and I know I can count on him to advise me on what kind of gear to use and how much lighting I need. He has the inventory to fully supply my big budgets, and he has the creativity to help me survive my small budgets. Plain and simple, he's the best Grip/Electric supplier in Orange County and I rely heavily on his creative participation to bring my visions to life.

Curt Apduhan
Producer - Cinematographer at WAYFINDERS
August 3, 2013, Curt was a client of Craig "Burnie"’s

I have collaborated with Burnie since the mid 1990's which has resulted in some of my best work. His skills over the years have blossomed and allow me to concentrate on creating the best image possible. From commercial work for Blue Cross and John Deere to my Emmy award winning feature documentary "Amargosa", Burnie has been with me every step of the way. My producers appreciate his sensitivity to their budgets along with the superlative grip & lighting crews he provides the production. The value Burnie brings with his up to date equipment is appreciated by everyone who has to work with his gear including cast and crew. I simply cannot recommend Burnie enough. - Curt Apduhan

Gabriella Lengua
Event & Media Producer
December 24, 2011, Gabriella was a client of Craig "Burnie"’s

Burnie and his team are the ones you want on all your projects.  He and his crew have a wide knowledge of all lighting situations.  Burnie just gets it-- he listens, he ascertains the scenario and he makes it all happen.  He takes care of his customers and is the consummate professional-- always polite and respectful, excellent with clients and crew, always resourceful and reliable.  His team is strong and match his level of expertise and professionalism.  Burnie offers more than what you would ever expect-- he's a business partner on your projects.  I am always happy to recommend Burnie, his team and his company overall.

April 27, 2010, Kent was a client of Craig "Burnie"’s

I have hired Burnie's company many times over the past years for my various productions and he has always provided exceptional service, with a friendly smile.  He stands behind his gear, which is always superbly maintained and up to date, and his crew, which has always exceeded my expectations.  On my most recent production, producing and shooting 184 episodes for Top Chef University for Bravo, he helped the production tremendously and made it clear he would take care of any issue we might encounter leaving me time to concentrate on my duties.  He is very talented and dependable.  Highly recommended.

Brent Hurlock
EditVision LLC, President and Owner
July 14, 2014, Brent worked with Craig "Burnie" in the same group

I've worked with digital media engineers from all over the world,and hundreds in and around the Los Angeles area, but by far Brent Hurlock is one of the best I have encountered. I've worked with Brent for over five years and have found him absolutely dedicated to his craft. He has a very sharp eye for focus, color grading, and framing. As a lighting professional, Brent is the first person I rely on to know when we have to match shots, or checking green screen levels. He is also looking out for all departments for continuity, framing and checking playback. I cant tell you how many times I've been on set and heard the phrase, "Go ask Brent". Brent is a master engineer and the East Coast is lucky to have him!
Brent Hurlock
